etymology.description: 色(sexual desire) + 魔(demon/fiend) = sex fiend; pervert
etymology.interpretation: Derogatory term for a lecherous person obsessed with sex; tone ranges from joking to strongly condemnatory depending on context.

parts.english: color; sexual desire; sensuality; facial expression

examples.chinese: 他老盯着女生看，简直是个色魔(他老盯著女生看，簡直是個色魔)。
examples.pinyin: Tā lǎo dīngzhe nǚshēng kàn, jiǎnzhí shì gè sèmó.
examples.english: He keeps staring at girls—he’s basically a pervert.

examples.chinese: 大家要小心那个色魔，尽量别单独和他见面(大家要小心那個色魔，儘量別單獨和他見面)。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā yào xiǎoxīn nàge sèmó, jǐnliàng bié dāndú hé tā jiànmiàn.
examples.english: Be careful of that pervert; try not to meet him alone.

examples.chinese: 媒体曝光后，这名色魔被警方逮捕(媒體曝光後，這名色魔被警方逮捕)。
examples.pinyin: Méitǐ bāoguāng hòu, zhè míng sèmó bèi jǐngfāng dàibǔ.
examples.english: After the media exposed him, this pervert was arrested by the police.
